BlueSkyの人口、去年のAI騒動で一気に伸びた後は随分下火になってるのね オレは人が大勢いる場所より静かな場所の方が好きだけど、狭くなりすぎると村社会みたいになってしまう側面もある 果たしてどうなる事やらオレのブルスカ生活

今月印象に残ってるのは、VCしてた人が割と普通の側の人間かと思ったら、ランクで敵に死体撃ちされた時に 相手のアカウント名をググって「ミカンさんこいつトランスジェンダーらしいですよｗ」って呼びかけられた事です お前それ言うてどないすんねんと ムカつく事自体は分かるけど30代がそういうラインを越えてどないすんねんと そしてその越えたラインを人に共有して相手に同意を求めるタイプの体で喋りかけてどないすんねんと ぼくは「こういうのは悪い奴が人の名前をパクっているだけという場合も多いから……」とだけ答えたけど、いや～ちょっとこの人とはもういいかなとなった 仕事でやったら一発クビになりかねんムーブやぞ

「仕事だったら当たり前やろ」が通じないのはマジできついし怖い でも逆に、こういう事やらんでもすぐに割と人間的に成長する人間も居るわけで……。
とりあえずいくつかのコミュニティを経てオレが今考えているのは「完全にガチャだし、数か月以上付き合える可能性のある人間と出会える可能性はほぼないと理解した上で、ささやかな人付き合いを楽しむ事なのでは」という事です まあなんだかんだオレもあんま経験積んでないから時間たったら考え改めたりするかもだけど

external.description:
CMGEとコーエーテクモが手掛ける新作モバイル向けアクションRPG『真・三國無双 覇』が、7月15日よりApp StoreとGoogle Playで事前登録を開始した。  
本作は『真・三國無双６』をベースに、シリーズ特有のチャージシステムや「一騎当千」の爽快アクションをスマホで再現。  
加えて「合体技」などの新要素を導入し、戦場の臨場感を最大100人規模で体験できる。  
ストーリーモードでは原作の物語を各勢力の視点で追体験可能で、英傑たちのドラマがシネマティックに描かれる。  
さらにローグライクや陣取り、領地運営など15種類以上の多彩なモードを実装し、戦略性とやり込み要素を兼ね備えている。  
武将同士の絆によって強力な合体技が解放されるシステムも魅力で、戦局を一変させる爽快感を味わえる。  
配信日などの詳細は未定だが、今後の情報は公式SNSで随時更新予定。

record.text:
粘土でよみがえるMOTHERの世界――渋谷PARCOで見つけた懐かしさと発見 - AIゲームまとめ

▼詳細はこちら

external.description:
2025年7月25日から9月8日まで、渋谷PARCO8階で「ほぼ日曜日」にて「MOTHER」関連の展示会が開催されます。展示内容には、ニンテンやネス、テディなどのキャラクターや敵キャラクターの造形が展示され、特にドット絵で描かれたゲームキャラクターを粘土フィギュアとして立体化した作品が目を引きます。

フィギュアの制作は「トットリさん」が担当し、フィギュアは長年倉庫で保管されていたものです。少しのシミやサビ、ヒビが見られるものの、それが「MOTHER」の歴史を感じさせる魅力となっています。展示会場では、フィギュアのディテールや色塗りの独特な味わいが強調され、ゲームの世界観を感じさせるデザインも随所に施されています。

また、展示品はゲームの流れに沿って配置され、プレイヤーは思い出を振り返りながら楽しむことができます。会場内には「MOTHER」シリーズのグッズを販売するミニショップもあり、関連グッズも多彩に揃っています。

タイ外務省によると、タイ側の死者数は14人、負傷者は45人。死傷者の7割超は民間人でした。
 
#ニュース

external.description: 【バンコク=井上航介】タイ国軍は25日、カンボジアとの軍事衝突でカンボジア兵およそ100人を殺害したと発表した。あわせてタイ側の一部国境地域で戒厳令を発令した。両軍の戦闘は激しさを増している。タイ国軍などによると、25日早朝に同国東北部4県付近のカンボジアとの係争地で衝突した。世界遺産「プレアビヒア寺院」の付近でも戦闘があった。カンボジア兵100人が死亡したのはシーサケート県の一部地域としてい

external.description: El ejecutivo estadounidense se encuentra en medio de una crisis alrededor del asunto de Epstein. Donald Trump aseguró el viernes que "nunca había sido informado" de la presencia de su nombre en los documentos judiciales, lo que condujo a la acusación del rico financiero Jeffrey Epstein por el tráfico sexual en menores en 2019. "Nunca me han informado", respondió el presidente estadounidense, que este caso ha envenenado durante varios días, entrevistado por periodistas en su descenso desde el avión cuando llegó a Escocia.

external.description: Tiryaki Agro, a leading agricultural products supply chain company worldwide, has been dedicated to providing healthy, reliable, and sustainable agricultural products since 1965. Confronted with the limitations of its legacy ERP system, Tiryaki Agro shifted to Dynamics 365 Finance and Supply Chain. This move enhanced system responsiveness and streamlined reporting, enabling Tiryaki Agro to speed up its operations. Today, generating 12-month financial reports takes 30 minutes instead of a full day. Tiryaki’s team can collaborate on the fly, rely on more transparent and holistic financial data, and cut infrastructure costs.

images.alt:
このイラストは、晴れた日の水辺で元気に遊ぶ少女の姿を描いています。

画面中央には、満面の笑みを浮かべ、両手を広げてバランスを取りながら水しぶきを上げる少女が描かれています。彼女は水色のパーカーを羽織り、その下には白いTシャツ、紺色のショートパンツを着用しています。足元は茶色のハイカットのブーツに、青い靴下をたるませて履いています。頭には水色のキャップをかぶり、二つに結んだ髪が肩に垂れています。背中にはベージュのリュックサックを背負っています。

少女の足元からはダイナミックに水しぶきが舞い上がり、透明感のある水の色が表現されています。背景には、緑豊かな丘陵地帯が広がり、ちらほらとキノコのような赤い植物が見えます。左下には、銀色の金属製の大きなバケツのようなものが置かれています。空は明るい水色で、夏の日の開放的な雰囲気を醸し出しています。全体的にアニメ調のタッチで描かれており、生き生きとした躍動感が感じられる一枚です。

📌 The Double-Edged Sword of Security Nudges: Balancing Effectiveness and User Fatigue https://www.cyberhub.blog/article/10388-the-double-edged-sword-of-security-nudges-balancing-effectiveness-and-user-fatigue

external.description:
Security nudges, techniques derived from behavioral economics, are powerful tools for influencing user behavior towards safer practices. By modifying environments or default choices, these nudges encourage secure actions without imposing restrictive measures. Examples include default security settings, prompts for multi-factor authentication, and warnings about suspicious links.

However, the effectiveness of security nudges can diminish if they are overused or misapplied, leading to user fatigue and reduced compliance. Technically, these nudges are integrated into security systems through user interface design, default configurations, and automated alerts. While effective, their impact lessens if users are bombarded with too many prompts or if the nudges are poorly designed.

The misuse of security nudges can have significant implications for the cybersecurity landscape. Overuse can lead to decreased compliance with security policies, increased vulnerability to cyber threats, and a general erosion of trust in security measures. Users may become desensitized to prompts and warnings, making them less vigilant and more likely to engage in risky behaviors.

To mitigate these risks, cybersecurity professionals must carefully design and implement security nudges. Best practices include using data-driven approaches to determine the optimal frequency and type of nudges, and continuously monitoring and adjusting these measures based on user feedback and behavior. By striking a balance between providing enough prompts to encourage safe behaviors and avoiding overuse that leads to fatigue, organizations can leverage security nudges to enhance their security posture.

In conclusion, while security nudges are a valuable tool in cybersecurity, their effectiveness hinges on careful implementation. By understanding the potential pitfalls and adopting best practices, organizations can leverage security nudges to enhance their security posture without overwhelming users.
external.title: The Double-Edged Sword of Security Nudges: Balancing Effectiveness and User Fatigue

record.text: 📌 Are Cybersecurity Certifications Losing Their Value in a Saturated Job Market? https://www.cyberhub.blog/article/10389-are-cybersecurity-certifications-losing-their-value-in-a-saturated-job-market

external.description: The cybersecurity job market is experiencing a paradox where many certified professionals, often with advanced degrees, are struggling to secure employment. This trend raises questions about the efficacy of certifications in guaranteeing job placement and the overall viability of a career in cybersecurity. Certifications such as CISSP, CEH, and CompTIA Security+ have long been considered essential for career advancement in cybersecurity. However, the current job market dynamics suggest a potential mismatch between the skills possessed by job seekers and the needs of employers. This situation could be attributed to market saturation, where the supply of certified professionals exceeds the demand for their skills. The oversupply of certified professionals may lead to a devaluation of certifications if they become too common without a corresponding increase in job opportunities. This scenario could have significant implications for the cybersecurity landscape. If certified professionals continue to struggle to find jobs, it may lead to a decrease in the perceived value of certifications. This could discourage new entrants into the field, potentially leading to a shortage of skilled professionals in the long run. Additionally, it might push professionals to seek additional qualifications or specializations to stand out in a crowded market. From an expert's perspective, certifications are important but not sufficient on their own. Practical experience, continuous learning, and networking are crucial for career growth. Employers often look for candidates who can demonstrate real-world skills and problem-solving abilities, not just theoretical knowledge. Therefore, professionals in the field should focus on gaining practical experience through internships, labs, and real-world projects. Networking and building a strong professional presence can also enhance job prospects. Additionally, staying updated with the latest trends and technologies in cybersecurity can make a candidate more attractive to employers. In conclusion, while certifications remain valuable, they are not a guarantee of employment. Professionals must complement their certifications with practical experience and continuous learning to navigate the competitive job market effectively.
external.title: Are Cybersecurity Certifications Losing Their Value in a Saturated Job Market?

record.text: 📌 Recent SharePoint attacks highlight the need for robust cryptographic protections. Perimeter security alone is insufficient. #CyberSecurity #DataProtection https://tinyurl.com/25k66gnr

external.description: Recent attacks targeting SharePoint have brought to light the critical importance of implementing robust cryptographic protections to safeguard data integrity and confidentiality. These incidents serve as a stark reminder that perimeter-based security measures alone are insufficient in today's threat landscape. Organizations must adopt a more comprehensive approach to secure their documents and sensitive information. The attacks on SharePoint highlight the vulnerabilities inherent in relying solely on perimeter defenses. Cybercriminals are increasingly bypassing these traditional security measures, necessitating the implementation of additional safeguards. Cryptographic protections, such as encryption, play a pivotal role in ensuring that even if attackers gain access to documents, the data remains unreadable and tamper-proof without the appropriate decryption keys. Moreover, the rise of zero-day attacks, which exploit unknown vulnerabilities, further complicates the security landscape. To mitigate these risks, organizations should prioritize strengthening their security posture through a combination of measures. Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is one such solution that adds an extra layer of security by requiring users to provide multiple forms of verification before accessing resources. This significantly reduces the risk of unauthorized access due to compromised credentials. In addition to MFA, adhering to best practices for cloud security is essential. These practices include regular security audits, timely patch management, stringent access controls, and continuous monitoring. By adopting these measures, organizations can better protect themselves against both known vulnerabilities and zero-day threats. The implications of these attacks on the broader cybersecurity landscape are significant. They underscore the evolving nature of cyber threats and the necessity for a defense-in-depth strategy. This approach involves layering multiple security measures to create a robust defense system that can withstand various types of attacks. For cybersecurity professionals, the key takeaway is the importance of shifting towards data-centric security measures. While perimeter defenses remain important, they should be complemented with data-level protections like encryption. Regularly updating and patching systems is crucial to mitigate known vulnerabilities, and implementing MFA can significantly reduce the risk of unauthorized access. Furthermore, continuous monitoring and anomaly detection can help organizations identify and respond to zero-day attacks more effectively. By adopting these practices, organizations can enhance their security posture and better protect their sensitive information from evolving cyber threats. In conclusion, the recent attacks on SharePoint serve as a critical reminder of the need for robust cryptographic protections and a comprehensive security strategy. By implementing MFA, adhering to cloud security best practices, and adopting a defense-in-depth approach, organizations can better safeguard their data against the ever-evolving threat landscape.
external.title: Recent SharePoint Attacks Underscore Need for Strong Cryptographic Protections

record.text: If AI is going to be taking our jobs, it might as well be for the stuff nobody wants to do 😆

GitHub Copilot with Claude Sonnet 4 did something I had failed to do until now: correctly review and fix *all* my COM reference count issues in MsRdpEx 👇

And yes, I did test it multiple times in various places where MsRdpEx is loaded, the refcounts all go nicely down to zero when freeing resources!

Names alone aren't sufficient, and it's not like we can just change the XML without breaking compatibility. A lot of the (bad) names are kept for historical reasons. Adding an LLM description attribute would be a non-breaking change with a lot of benefits for an MCP server in RDM

I referred to myself as a Luddite just today to a colleague because I steadfastly don’t use ChatGPT, Copilot, or other prompt driven AI bot.

I prefer correct answers and not have it parrot things I already know. The last bit is an instant give away that a coworker used AI to try to solve a problem.
You know he wanted to use his junk instead of his arm.

This skeet really makes me wish Bluesky had thread folding. 

cc: @pfrazee.com

Russia’s Aerospace Under Siege: Inside the Stealthy Operation CargoTalon Cyberattack

A New Cyber-Espionage Campaign Sends Shockwaves Through Russian Defense In a chilling new revelation, cybersecurity researchers from SEQRITE Labs have uncovered an aggressive and highly targeted cyber-espionage…

external.description: A New Cyber-Espionage Campaign Sends Shockwaves Through Russian Defense In a chilling new revelation, cybersecurity researchers from SEQRITE Labs have uncovered an aggressive and highly targeted cyber-espionage operation aimed directly at Russia’s aerospace and defense sectors. Dubbed Operation CargoTalon, the campaign zeroes in on Voronezh Aircraft Production Association (VASO)—a major player in Russia’s aviation industry. What sets this attack apart is its use of highly customized malware and sophisticated spear-phishing tactics embedded in what appear to be legitimate consignment documents.
external.title: Russia’s Aerospace Under Siege: Inside the Stealthy Operation CargoTalon Cyberattack

external.description: In today’s hyper-connected world, device security isn’t just about privacy—it’s about protecting critical infrastructure that keeps society running smoothly. A recent warning from the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has brought to light a serious security flaw affecting hundreds of LG LNV5110R cameras worldwide. This vulnerability could allow hackers to gain full administrative control over these devices, posing significant risks to commercial and critical infrastructure sectors.
